text: hello my needle drops Anthony Fantana
here
Internet's busiest music nerd and I hope
everyone had a good Halloween weekend
recovering from all that candy eating
all that Satan worshipping don't act
like you don't do it I know you're sick
disgusting habits and what better way to
indulge in those habits than by
reviewing the new electric wizard album
black masses I've been anticipating this
review for weeks mostly because you guys
have been requesting it like mad with
comments like this one and this one one
this one this one this one but but also
electric wizard is one of the toughest
acts to follow in doom stoner sludge
whatever you want to call it metal for
over 15 years they've built a reputation
on their thick sound and heavy riffs but
this LP is a change in that formula even
if it is just a small one the most
obvious change for me between this album
and electric Wizards previous LP which
called today is the overall tempo of
this thing electric wizard is not
stopping to smell the roses on this LP
like they used to which may disappoint
some people hoping for another dope
throne though black masses does have its
slow moments this thing is not a
gigantic lizard monster stomping slowly
through city streets and punching
buildings and smashing cars which is
usually how I like to picture some of my
favorite do metal albums black masses
feels a lot more like a down-tuned psych
rock record which isn't necessarily a
bad thing because electric wizard really
labored over the mix on this LP some of
my favorite songs here start with a riff
and kind of build into this wall of
sound that is just impenetrable I'm
talking about tracks that build up into
a density that is so intense it feels
like I'm about to have a mental
breakdown kind of like Sater 9
Scorpios curse Venus in furs and these
walls of Sounders is built out of
swirling phantom noises just stuff I
have no idea as to how to identify
freaky guitar solos some drones as well
kind of hanging in the air it sounds
like a dense doom lasagna but there are
some tracks on here that play it kind of
safe by electric wizard standards
they're not too slow they're not too
noisy the riffs are maybe a little
nondescript
they kind of feel like electric wizard
is playing it a little safe they're kind
of like electric wizard singles focusing
on what's easygoing what's accessible as
opposed to what's experimental my major
gripe with this LP though is a slightly
slightly muddy sound just enough so that
some of the riffs some of the sounds
some of what I really want to come out
of the speakers and hit me hard is
getting maybe just a little lost in
translation intentional or not it's not
the most appealing thing in the world I
love that electric wizard is trying to
maintain this 70s aesthetic with their
recording style really to call back to
those classic bands in Doom like Black
Sabbath like trouble but the more I turn
this record up the more difficult that
becomes for me to kind of decipher
what's going on I really don't feel like
I'm sunbaking in this massive sound as
much as I am kind of just like getting a
spray tan I didn't hate not a single
track on this LP though even the
closer's pretty good the Crypt of drug
EULA which is this drone II noisy piece
full of lightning strikes very kind of
ambient but also ominous at the same
time but then again it's not like this
album had me on my knees speaking in
tongues and worshiping at the Black Mass
either it took a little time to grow on
me but I'm feeling like a decent two
strong six on this thing I like it but
I'm not in love with it I know there are
a lot of hardcore electric wizard fans
watching what do you guys think of this
record how do you think it compares to
their early stuff especially dope thrown
and especially which cult today and even
their self-titled L
as well and I'm sure you guys will also
tell me in the comments below what you
think I should be reviewing next Anthony
Fantana electric wizard black masses
forever
